Module atu.aicme4j

module atu.aicme4j
Defines a simple API (one JAR file only) to enable students to quickly learn about how artificial neural networks work under the hood and provide an easy mechanism to configure, train and use them.

Intended Users
This software is designed to be used by undergraduate software development students, specifically to enable them to see how a neural network can be implemented as a set of arrays, how weights can be used to store knowledge and how a supervised training algorithm can be applied to adjust the weights. Budding machine learning specialists or data science aficionados should try more comprehensive frameworks like Smile (Statistical Machine Intelligence and Learning Engine) or DeepLearning4J .

The documentation in this module includes an overview and examples of the API being used. @See jhealy.aicme4j.net

Since:
Aicme4j 1.0
Version:
Aicme4j 1.0
Author:
Dr. John Healy, ATU.
